How can I set the font size of the legend title to a smaller size in Matplotlib? I have a code that sets the font size for the legend, but it does not affect the legend title font size. Here's the code I'm working with:

```python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from matplotlib.pyplot import *
from matplotlib.font_manager import FontProperties

fontP = FontProperties()
fontP.set_size('xx-small')
fig=plt.figure()
ax1=fig.add_subplot(111)
plot([1,2,3], label="test1")
ax1.legend(loc=0, ncol=1, bbox_to_anchor=(0, 0, 1, 1),
           prop = fontP,fancybox=True,shadow=False,title='LEGEND')
plt.show()
```
The resulting plot shows that the font size setting does not affect the legend title font size.

To adjust the font size of the legend title in Matplotlib, you need to use the `title_fontsize` parameter when calling `ax1.legend()`. This parameter allows you to specify the font size of the legend title separately from the rest of the legend text. Here's how you can modify your code to set a smaller font size for the legend title:

```python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from matplotlib.font_manager import FontProperties

fontP = FontProperties()
fontP.set_size('xx-small')

fig = plt.figure()
ax1 = fig.add_subplot(111)

# Plotting the data
ax1.plot([1, 2, 3], label="test1")

# Setting the legend with a smaller title font size
ax1.legend(loc=0, ncol=1, bbox_to_anchor=(0, 0, 1, 1),
           prop=fontP, fancybox=True, shadow=False, title='LEGEND', title_fontsize='x-small')

plt.show()
```

In this modified code, the `title_fontsize` parameter is set to `'x-small'`, but you can choose any standard Matplotlib font size such as `'small'`, `'medium'`, `'large'`, etc., or specify an integer value for more precise control. This change will ensure that the legend title appears with the desired smaller font size.
